summary: Baking soda, or sodium bicarbonate, is a white powdery chemical compound used in baking. It helps cupcakes and other baked goods rise by creating tiny bubbles of carbon dioxide gas. Baking soda has many names, like bicarbonate of soda or bread soda, and is commonly found near baking powder in stores. The "bi-" in bicarbonate comes from an old naming system and means there's twice as much carbonate per sodium in this compound compared to sodium carbonate.
title: Sodium bicarbonate
